forumNotes.author: rashw001
forumNotes.content: Ok, needing usb recovery software for acer aspire one. I want to factory reset my net book, because the net book comes on then blue flash screen then restart, then ask if I like start safe mode or restart normally. Then does the same thing again after I make any choice. Help Please!

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: If it is Windows 7 starter, download a Win 7 DVD ISO and make a USB pen following [http://sites.google....ials/firawiniso](https://sites.google.com/site/rmprepusb/tutorials/firawiniso "External link") then choose the Repair option. Do NOT install from the DVD as you will not be able to activate it.

forumNotes.author: rashw001
forumNotes.content: Sorry forgot to add in description it is a win xp OS on aspire one net book. Never came with recovery cd. Is there any way to factory reset it.

forumNotes.author: al_jo
forumNotes.content:
> Sorry forgot to add in description it is a win xp OS on aspire one net book. Never came with recovery cd. Is there any way to factory reset it.  
Perhaps you only need the "Recovery Console for XP"?  
Read more here:  
[http://forums.pcpits...nsole-wo-xp-cd/](http://forums.pcpitstop.com/index.php?/topic/150212-boot-to-recovery-console-wo-xp-cd/ "External link")

forumNotes.author: sbaeder
forumNotes.content:
> Perhaps you only need the "Recovery Console for XP"?  
> Read more here:  
> [http://forums.pcpits...nsole-wo-xp-cd/](http://forums.pcpitstop.com/index.php?/topic/150212-boot-to-recovery-console-wo-xp-cd/ "External link")  
Also, did it come with the option to make a recovery disk? If so, it might be on a hidden partition (i.e. look around on the Aspire support sites for a "F" key to press to boot into recovery. Quick google found that Alt+F10 at power on MAY be the right key combo to use...If you have files you need to keep, best to boot into a PE to save them first.
